chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Lavon Clayton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to spend 20 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said defendant's non-compliance with conditions of probation. Defendant taken into custody.

records.addlTxt:
Received, signed and filed:
Order for Restitution.
Copies forwarded to the parties on today's date.
cab

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Kremers
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
   DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Agent to contact the court if he needs another date.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.  Statement by the parties and the defendant.
As to count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 1 year in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 207 days time served.  
As to count 1:
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV and DNA surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at $913.50 to be paid to South Milwaukee through the Probation Department.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $34  witness fees for witness NICOLE A. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request X26210602 in court 2X on 4/13/15, 6/29/15.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4 & 5
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered counts 3, 4 & 5 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored, and he must provide a DNA sample. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 1 amended to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer, 939.62(1)(b).
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 2 amended to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer, 939.62(1)(b).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trail. 1st call, parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.

Attorney Eamon Collins Guerin in court, defendant Terry Lavon Clayton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 06/29/2015.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Eamon Guerin.  Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court informed parties that any motions must be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart. Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody. Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Jury Trial. Defendant requested new appointment of counsel. For reasons placed on the record, the court GRANTED defendant's request. Defendant WAIVED his Speedy Trial Demand to allow for new counsel to be appointed. Defendant to be produced for next court date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Terry Lavon Clayton not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Defendant NOT produced. Case called at 1:30 PM to allow defense counsel to appear in court.  Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, all conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 04/13/2015.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart. Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody. Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: South Milwaukee Police Officer Steven Hesse. State rests.  Defense rests. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding cases 12CM3509, 12CM2523, and 10CM4034 that are attached to the complaint. Defense motioned to strike count 1, court DENIED motion. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; Repeater modifier amended to 939.62(1)(b) as to counts 2, 3, 4, and 5, defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nicole A.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Terry Lavon Clayton in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
